oai_dc:dc.dc:title: An assessment of the economic benefits of a mastitis control scheme
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Blowey, R. W.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Over a six-year period from 1979 to 1985 the incidence of mastitis among dairy herds being recorded in a veterinary practice in Gloucestershire decreased from 26路5 per cent to 19路6 per cent of cows affected each year and from 51 路0 to 31 路7 cases per 100 cows per year. Full article published in Veterinary Record (1986) 119, 551-553
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1986; 48
